steps.label: Open Browser
steps.desc: User opens a new browser window or tab.

steps.label: Navigate to Address Bar
steps.desc: User focuses address bar to type a URL or a query.

steps.label: Enter google.com
steps.desc: User types 'google.com' in address bar.

steps.label: Confirm Navigation
steps.desc: User presses Enter to navigate to google.com.

steps.label: Browser Recognizes URL
steps.desc: Browser identifies 'google.com' as a domain.

steps.label: Initialize Connection Sequence
steps.desc: Browser prepares to start DNS resolution.

steps.label: Potential Cache Check
steps.desc: Browser checks local DNS cache for google.com IP.

steps.label: Browser UI Loading State
steps.desc: Browser updates tab UI, indicates loading in progress.

steps.label: User Waits
steps.desc: User sees a spinner or loading indicator in the tab.

steps.label: Auto-complete or Suggest
steps.desc: Browser might show suggestions if recognized as a search.

steps.label: Finalize Decision
steps.desc: Browser decides it's a direct URL (http/https).

steps.label: Protocol Determination
steps.desc: Modern browsers force https for google.com.

steps.label: Construct Request Shell
steps.desc: Browser prepares an HTTPS request structure.

steps.label: Pending DNS Step
steps.desc: Browser notes it must first do DNS resolution.

steps.label: Keyboard Focus Shifts
steps.desc: User's focus moves away from address bar.

steps.label: UI Possibly Renders Partial
steps.desc: Some browsers render partial UI, or blank screen with spinner.

steps.label: Initiate Search Intent
steps.desc: Though we typed a domain, the browser is ready for a search query if needed.

steps.label: User Considers Next Step
steps.desc: In case the page doesn't load instantly, user might re-check the typed domain.

steps.label: Browser Gathers System Info
steps.desc: Browser can check system proxy settings or VPN status.

steps.label: Trigger Networking Code
steps.desc: A networking process is started inside the browser engine.

steps.label: Browser Prepares Thread
steps.desc: Browser spawns a thread or uses an existing net stack for the request.

steps.label: Check Security Policies
steps.desc: Browser ensures no security plugin or policy is blocking google.com.

steps.label: Check Local Hosts File
steps.desc: Browser/OS quickly checks if google.com is in /etc/hosts or system hosts file.

steps.label: Potential Intranet Check
steps.desc: Some corporate networks check if domain is overridden locally.

steps.label: Ready for External DNS
steps.desc: If not found in local steps, browser is set to query DNS server.

steps.label: UI Minimally Painted
steps.desc: A blank or minimal white page is shown to user with loading indicator.

steps.label: Connection Start Marker
steps.desc: Browser logs 'startTime' or something for performance metrics.

steps.label: Delay or PreFetch
steps.desc: Some browsers might have google.com prefetch; if so, DNS is skipped.

steps.label: No Prefetch Found
steps.desc: If no prefetch data, continue normal resolution.

steps.label: Browser Confirms Need for DNS
steps.desc: Yes, we definitely need to talk to DNS server now.

steps.label: User Possibly Switches Tab
steps.desc: User might switch away while it continues in background.

steps.label: User Possibly Switches Back
steps.desc: User returns to the tab, sees it still loading or about to load.

steps.label: Cookie Check
steps.desc: Browser checks existing google.com cookies if any.

steps.label: History & Cache Check
steps.desc: Browser may see if google.com has a local cache version.

steps.label: Potential Service Worker
steps.desc: If there's a google.com service worker, it might intercept.

steps.label: No Worker Intercept
steps.desc: Usually google.com is not served by a local service worker, so proceed.

steps.label: Create Internal Request Object
steps.desc: Now the request is about to be fully formed with method=GET, headers, etc.

steps.label: Queue This Request
steps.desc: Browser puts the request in the network queue.

steps.label: Moving to DNS Phase
steps.desc: Browser transitions to actual DNS resolution.

steps.label: End of Phase 1
steps.desc: Initial user interaction steps are done. Next phase: DNS/TCP/SSL.
